column5: c'est un(e) beau/belle omble de fontaine.

Awesome pics guys. Quick question, when fishing creeks like these with a spinning reel, what type of tackle would you recommend? I've got my UL rod and 4 pound line, but i need something at the end of it! Catching chubs on the Humber is the most I've ever creek fished.

when i fish creeks i use a very small spinner or a woolly bugger fly and a few small steelhead shot.  i like to use single hooks and pinch my barbs. the barbs even on the smallest of spinners is pretty damaging to little parrs.  good luck alder bashing!
Great pictures Gents
Got to love them speckies!!!

I get the huge ones in the spring! Them brookies wont see me coming! I use mostly use mepps,panther martin, lil cleos,williams spoons,and my special jig flies to get them big ol' brookies into the boat!(I cant post pictures because my pics are too big!)
Troutboy, Photobucket will automatically resize them... It's also free!
them be rainbows troots no?
This isn't my photo. I found it on the web some time back. It's perhaps the best Brook Trout photo that I've ever seen though. Kudos to the photographer.
Great thread - let's keep it going!  Here's a personal favourite...snapped by your's truly.

Yep, those specks live in some nice country, that's for sure. Half the fun is just getting where they live.          Its always worth it when your rewarded with this........    And some for you softwater guys too      S.
Beauty color on that speckle Bill......love it!!!  A lot different from this stocked Speckie..
I'd take that goliath you are holding up anyday!!!!  Looks like a football, but bigger

Certainly jealous of all the beautiful streams/rivers some of you have in your backyards. The specs are mostly in lakes around here with a few small creeks in between.  Cant complain though. Still gods country lake or river.        Since were sneakn in a couple spec pics....... heres one from a creek about 6 feet wide.   These are all back lake specs.     Fall kyped mouth spec     Cant wait to put a few miles on the new fly rod this summer.  And Steve I didnt know you hit up the browns last fall? Gonna have to tell me about it this weeknd on the trip.

Wow!!  Yep.  Some lakes get fished out..  Word gets out that those lakes a trout factories..  They get added to the list.  And there's always a few fish that manage to elude fisherman and grrooowww!!  Last year's back country ice trip in Espanola..      3 days, crazy blizzards, righteous cold..  One fish.    Reality bites!  HD
I'm surprised we haven't seen one of these...

Cause most Brookie haunts take a lot to get to, and are back in the boonies, so unless you've actualy already been there....you'd have no idea of where your looking at.   For exsample...this is one of my Prime spots. There is a hump of boulders that creaps up from about 20' to 6' with a mixed gravel/mud bottom flat on top...that fallen pine just sticking out is actually 2 trees. The trees rest right above the drop off....its a bloody spec gold mine on the deep end during the day, and it switches to the shallow gravel side at night when they feed at the surface.  If you can guess where it is I say cudos to you, and have at it. I pulled more then few out of that fallen pine on several occasions LOL... Just be ready to work for it  Cheers,
Very nice shots guys!!

Hey Mike.....gotta keep a few cards in my back pocket   New fly rod eh???.....we are gonna have some fun this Spring and Summer.......looking forward to the trek up North on Friday....see ya soon Bud!!!
When do Brook Trout open?
Opening weekend.

Hey Doc,  How about some video footage of the same place?      Every Brookie is something special to me... I just don't understand how someone can put these in a pan? (Hey that's my opinion, if ya wanna keep em, fine, just not on my trips)...

great vids ron.  it really is a nice boat ride.  the one day i went it had just finished raining for several hours...  there was intermittent waterfalls flowing down everywhere in the canyon.   i'll have to dig the pics out....  incredible country.
p.s. none of mine from THERE went in the pan, but when it comes to speck that are between 12-14 inches i'm eating the heck out of it!
Oops, should have written that differently......  I was not referring to you Doc. I was referring to my number one rule when I invite people on certain trips North.
Hey Ron. I've always liked these couple of shots that you took for me. Let's do it again sometime soon.
That's a beauty.  (The fish....)
Hey Dan,  Still got the one you framed for me up on the wall.
i've yet to see a prettier fish than a big shouldered male from the 807.
I've really enjoyed this thread. The scenery, banter and fish have been nothing short of spec-tacular.  Thanks for sharing everyone!
love em love em love EM!    some are samll and are the best to eat.    and other well....     are just made to go on the wall!
Not looking for any info at all, just wondering if anyone else gets them out of here? Lets see yours if you have them. R
Nothing better than small stream Brookies - Spring can't come soon enough!  Here's a little spot that holds some nice fish:        Here's a nice one from a few years ago, opening weekend.
here's a nice spot
Now this is a thread I can get into!  I'm dreaming of spring speck fishing.  Here's one of my favorite spots to catch my favorite fish.
Here is a couple caught within a half hour drive from downtown Toronto, from different tribs.  PB for a GTA trib   pretty one from different trib   C'mon spring!
Confirms it!!!!! BROOK TROUT= AMAZING LOCATIONS!!! R

Man you guys are killin me.....beauty spots with the best fish in all the world.  That shot from the Sault area----man, having lived there some time ago I do know that is one of the prettiest areas in Canada---From Sault north to wawa  When I was younger I used to live to walk those streams  Now all's I can add is this done a while ago----sniff, sniff
Counting the days!
I actually recognize more of those spots than I had expected to, and all have produced but there's oh so many more!  can't wait til the annual spring trip!  jjcanoe
Smitter, I could fish a place like that all day and not catch a thing and be completely satisfied.  Absolutely gorgeous...

This is one of my favourite spots for brook trout. Nothing very large where these are caught but they are very tasty...dark too!

holy crap!! ppl are actually posting pics of their top secret brookie locations!! im shocked!!

After hours of navigating (AKA climbing) several of these....up and down and all over again.    Canoeing countless lakes like these in nice sunny but cool skies....    That turn into uncertain weather like this...    That enables cool findings like this...    But eventually leads you this...a few times over if we're lucky    And comes with a morning coffee view like this for free...     Yup... Thats my favorite

I'm not a fan of having to make reservations to use a broken down thunderbox or dodging irate cottage associations with a more ingrained entitlement complex than Paris Hilton, so my spec fishing prospects have been a little thin over the last decade.
